means: 凭理智（而非感情）办事的人

sentence.Network_en: They had a snobbish dislike for their intellectual and social inferiors.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们非常势利，不喜欢智力和社会地位不如自己的人。

sentence.Network_en: Sontag has always been that rarity, a glamorous intellectual.
sentence.Network_cn: 桑塔格一直是那种兼具美貌与智慧的人中龙凤。

sentence.Network_en: Without continued learning, graduates will lose their intellectual vitality.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果不继续学习，毕业生就会失去思想上的活力。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 知字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 知识〖 knowledge〗 知识分子〖 intellectual〗 知识青年〖 edeucatedyouth〗.
... . . .于不同的符号形态(symbolic forms)编译出不同的信息，而不同的媒介具有不同的符号形态,所以它门便具有不同的理性或知识（intellectual）和感性（emotional）偏倚。.
英语词汇的奥秘 ... perceptual 感性的 intellectual 智力的 conceptual 概念的.

list.abs: 心理学专业词... ... intellectualistic psychology 重智心理学重智心理学 intellectuality 理智性 intellectualization 理智化.
...便到处宣扬说，另一个人残酷地谋杀过多少人，使人相信有一天这个人也会被别人杀死，并且是罪有应得的。 “理智化”(intellectualization)—经常有机会动感情的人，他不能感情用事，久之便采取一种以抽象的理智漠然对待的态度，这叫做“理智化”。.
智能化科技革命推动人类社会进入智能时代智能化科技革命将促进人类社会从自动化 (Automation) 向智能化(Intellectualization)转变,即从“3A”(生产自动化、办公自动化.
intellectualized 智能化的intellectually 知性上intelligence ageney 情报局

means.word_mean: 勤奋的,天才的,受过教育的,有学问的
理智的,明智的,合逻辑的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin intellectualis, from intellectus 'understanding', from intellegere 'understand' (see intelligent)

entry.def: Intellectual means involving a person's ability to think and to understand ideas and information.

example.ex: High levels of lead could damage the intellectual development of children...
example.tran: 铅含量过高会损害儿童的智力发展。

example.ex: He has written seven thrillers, and clearly enjoys intellectual pursuits.
example.tran: 他已经写了7本惊悚小说,显然很喜欢这样的智力活动。

entry.def: An intellectual is someone who spends a lot of time studying and thinking about complicated ideas.

example.tran: 教师、艺术家和其他知识分子

means.word_mean: 1. a person who uses the mind creatively
1. of or relating to the intellect;
2. of or associated with or requiring the use of the mind;

sentences.sentence: "the triumph of the rational over the animal side of man"

means.word_mean: 3. appealing to or using the intellect;

sentences.sentence: "intellectual workers engaged in creative literary or artistic or scientific labor"
"has tremendous intellectual sympathy for oppressed people"

means.word_mean: 4. involving intelligence rather than emotions or instinct;

Sentence.sentence: We might look to other countries for models of how high schools can offer better training, as well as the development of a work ethic ( 勤奋工作的美德 ) and the intellectual skills needed for continued learning and development.
He took a 30% salary cut but felt it worthwhile for the greater intellectual opportunities.
What we want to encourage in these students is an active intellectual experience, in which they develop the wide range of complex reasoning abilities required of good lawyers.

L) The college admission essay contains the grandest American themes―status anxiety, parental piety (孝顺), intellectual standards—and so it is only a matter of time before it becomes infected by the country's culture of excessive concern with self-esteem.

No one knows the precise use Google will make of the intellectual property it has gained by scanning the world's library books, and the truth, as Gleick, an American science writer and member of the Authors Guild, points out, is that the company probably doesn't even know itself.
